title: You're All Alone
description: The twelve commandments*Always keep up appearances*Always be doing something*Always be first or last*Always be alone*Always have a route of escape*Never hesitate, or you're lost*Never do anything odd - it wouldn't be noticed*Never move things - it makes gaps*Never run - they're faster*Never touch anyone - DANGER MACHINERY!*Some animals are really alive*Never look at a stranger - it might be one of themDisobey these laws at your peril. In this world of imitation people, where it is dangerous to let it be known you're alive - YOU'RE ALL ALONE.The complete novel and other stories by Fritz Leiber.Contents:You're All Alone (1953) novelFour Ghosts in Hamlet (1965)The Creature from Cleveland Depths (1962)
author: Fritz Leiber
